intro: Schmidelia dentata, commonly known as the toothed schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a serrated edge, contributing to its common name. Schmidelia dentata typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded understories.
